attributes.action: Members of Parliament must be at least 40 years old
attributes.additional_details:
No individual should be eligible to stand for election to the House of Commons until they are forty years old.
By then they will hopefully have had a proper job, and ideally have employed people. Much better to have representatives who have some experience of the 'real world', rather than so many bright young things who go  from further education, usually Oxbridge, straight into politics.
